channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2024031398
item.description:
Report X-2024031398

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the van at WA 676 at NOKC 732 wet and leaking from a bottle of cleaning concentrate that had a loose cap. Package was placed into a red tote with a hazmat bag. DescribePack: Box was wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a red tote with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024031169
item.description:
Report X-2024031169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the unload. Upon discovery, the package had been placed in a red hazmat tote. The container had been wet. The contents had leaked from loose caps due to not having paint clips. The package should not have left 0755 MESQ. The SPIDR search on the package shows that the package had been damaged before going through the scan tunnel. DescribePack: The contents had leaked from loose caps due to not having paint clips. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery, the package had been placed in a red hazmat tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in the unload with container soiled. Internal contents have loose caps causing internal leakage. DescribePack: top and side of box wet and loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I quickly cleaned up surrounding area. Then I placed materials into a clear hazardous waste bag and inside a red hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024031039
item.description:
Report X-2024031039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR WAS AUDTING A PACKAGE CAR AND NOTICE A BOX THAT HAD A PACKING SLIPE AND READ THE CONTENTS OF SAID BOX AND LOOKED UP THE ITEMS AND FOUND OUT THEY WERE A HAZARDOS MATERIALS. SHE THEN CALLED THE HAZARDOUS HELP LINE WHO TOLD HER TO OPEN TO CONFIRM THE CONTENTS THEY SAID IT WAS A SUSPECTED UNDECLARED. PACKAGE AUDIT DUE TO PACKING LIST DESCRIPTION; NO LEAK. CORROSIVE LIQUID, BASIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S.

item.title: Report X-2024030976
item.description:
Report X-2024030976

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BROKEN ARROW
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded, a package handler noticed that the bottom of the box was leaking. It was then brought to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: The can/bottle was clearly being punctured throughout it's trip here due to inadequate protection. The puncture on the bottom caused the can to crack, allowing liquid to come through. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in the Hazardous material tote, then wrapped in a hazardous material bag away from other employees/package handlers.

item.title: Report X-2024031014
item.description:
Report X-2024031014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT 20:00 WHILE PERFORMING A HAZMAT AUDIT ON A PACKAGE CAR UPS HAZMAT AUDITOR PULLED AN UN MARKED BOX AND OPENED THE PACKING SLIP LOCATED ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. SHE THEN LOOKED UP THE SDS FOR THE PRODUCT LISTED ON THE PACKING SLIP AND NOTICED IT SAID THE ITEM WAS REGULATED FOR TRANSPORTATION. SHE THEN CALLED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER WHO INSTRUCTED HER TO OPEN THE BOX TO CONFIRM THE CONTENTS. THE CONTENTS WERE CONFIRMED AND THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER SAID THE BOX WAS A SUSPECTED UNDECLARED HAZMAT AND TO GIVE IT TO A DESIGNATED RESPONDER.
